translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, including the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly emulates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we are presenting a brand-new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers deliver an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Even these amps, of course, contain the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier. This is based in part on real analog circuits, because they simply do a better job of capturing the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system from which the natural resonances simply burst forth.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and distort historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound like you've always imagined. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which led to a performance boost for the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics and numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the compact VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed so that all guitarists seeking maximum sound diversity will find what they're looking for here. All guitarists dream of the warmth and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and prompt response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the output stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit with a 12AX7 tube in every VT+ amplifier embodies the behavior, the subtle nuances, and the sound character of a tube amplifier perfectly."
reference: Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously been improved, which has lead to, among other things, the combination of groundbreaking modeling technology with the “Valve Reactor” circuit with which the behavior of a tube amplifies is perfectly reproduced. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we present a brand-new modeling engine, which is the absolute state-of-the-art in the field of sound. Thanks to VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which utilizes an analysis of the components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifier puts forth an authenticity, which is absolutely impressive. These amps also include the multi-leveled Valvetronix tube amplifiers, of course. This deals with real analogue circuits, because these simply are better than any simulation at obtaining the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifier offers a closed casing and bass reflex system, from which natural resonances just burst out. With VOX’s “Tone Room” software, you can even correct and bend historical facts on a virtual plane until the amp and the effects sound just like you have always imagined them. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is above all thanks to the VOX valve reactor technology introduced in 2001. Naturally, it has been refined ever since then in order to handle new sound requirements, which in 2010 lead to a renewed power boost to the VOX Valvetronix series with more dynamics as well as numerous, decisively improved amplifier models. From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has additionally been designed in such a way that all guitarists looking for maximum sound variety will find what they need here. All guitarists dream of the pressure and the dynamics of a tube amp: They want a fat sound, a nuanced playback of playing dynamics and chord strokes, as well as a prompt response. During an in-depth analysis the VOX engineers discovered that the output stage above all else determines the tube character of an amplifier and they developed the VOX Valve reactor technology on the basis of this discovery. The Valve reactor circuit of any VT+ amplifier equipped with a 12AX7 tube produces the character, the subtle nuances and the sound shape of a tube amplifier perfectly.

translation1: "I am checking that. I am speaking with the bank and will contact you again, thank you for the support."

translation1: "If it's not possible, I would be satisfied with a legacy or voucher as well. Under certain circumstances, I might find a buyer for the furniture. However, paying over 1,000 euros for items that I don't need is still a bit too much."

reference: In case that doesn’t work, I would also be content with a rebate or store credit. If need be I can find someone to pick-up the furniture. Over 1,000 Euro for goods that I don’t need is really rather much.

reference: I also ordered a lamp shade with you, which is still being delivered. Now I can see, that the item is too big/bulky and not made for my tastes. That is why I ordered another draping piece.

translation1: "Basketball Bundesliga: Derby disaster for MHP Giants Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim At least Johannes Patrick, the youngster, let them down. Again nothing: for the second time in less than three months, the giants lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach, John Patrick, had said with a look back on the cup defeat at the beginning of October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim: \"We still have some anger in our belly.\" But this didn't calm down after the game - on the contrary, it was further intensified in view of the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. Where more than the bare result, the manner of the appearance disappointed.A substitute statistic expresses the entire dilemma: The three-point shot percentage was a mere 13 percent, with 4 successful shots (all by young John Patrick) out of 31 attempts - any questions? John Patrick provided the answer: \"We were simply not focused enough after our win in Tenerife, and we didn't implement what we had trained for.\" Namely, moving the ball.His counterpart, Sebastian Gleim, reacted very differently: \"It's great to win the game for the second time against Ludwigsburg,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" Although only 750 visitors were allowed on Saturday in the Hohenlohe Arena, they made the most of it.Not only because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led his team's game. \"The best playmaker I've ever trained,\" praised Gleim. While in Patrick's team, the key performers like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) underperformed.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total disaster and came within eight points, after they had already trailed by 39:59. In addition to Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also scored twelve points. Fortunately, there is not much time for complaining.Already on Wednesday (7 PM) the giants receive the Skyliners Frankfurt, then also in Ludwigsburg with a maximum of 750 spectators."
gpt_response:
```json
{
  "Cohesion": {
    "Lexical Cohesion Mistakes": [
      "let them down" (incorrect context, possibly meant to be 'did not let them down'),
      "young John Patrick" (the use of 'young' before 'John Patrick' is incorrect, should be 'young Johannes Patrick' or 'the youngster Johannes Patrick'),
      "again nothing" (phrasing lacks coherence, should be rephrased for better understanding),
      "Where more than the bare result" (incorrect phrasing, should be 'Not just the score' or similar),
      "A substitute statistic" (unclear reference, 'A key statistic' would be more appropriate),
      "Namely, moving the ball" (awkward placement, disrupting the flow),
      "Only in the last quarter" (the use of 'Only' makes the sentence ambiguous and lacking in clarity),
      "the best playmaker" (incongruent term, should be 'the best player' as in the reference text)
    ],
    "Grammatical Cohesion Mistakes": [
      "let them down" (the context suggests this should be affirmative, not negative),
      "on the contrary, it was further intensified in view of" (poorly structured phrase, could be 'on the contrary, it intensified after'),
      "Where more than the bare result" (this clause lacks proper conjunction or preposition, 'Not only the score' is a clearer phrase),
      "A substitute statistic" (article 'a' is inappropriate, should be 'This statistic' or simply 'The statistic'),
      "Not only because of" (should be 'Not just because of', to match the reference text and maintain parallelism),
      "the best playmaker" (should be 'the best player' to match reference text and maintain subject consistency),
      "then also in Ludwigsburg" (awkward phrasing, 'once again in Ludwigsburg' provides better cohesion)
    ]
  }
}
```
reference: National basket ball league: Derby-Debakel, MHP Ludwigsburg Giants at Merlins Crailsheim At least the youngster Johannes Patrick was reliable. Nothing, again: For the second time within less than three months the Giants lost in Crailsheim - and how! John Patrick, the trainer for Ludwigsburg, said before the game in reference to the previous finals loss in the beginning of October to HAKRO Crailsheim Merlins that: “We are still angry about it”. But this was note put to rest after the game, but rather it increased once again after the 61-72 (28-38) defeat in the basketball league. It wasn’t just the score that was disappointing, but also the way they showed up. A statistic was given for this which expresses the whole dilemma: The triple quota was only 13 percent, 4 hits (all from the young Johannes Patrick) and a whopping 31 attempts - any questions? The answer was given by John Patrick: “We were simply not concentrated enough after the victory at Teneriffa and we didn’t put into practice what we had trained.” They just didn’t move the ball. His counterpart Sebastian Gleim reacted much differently: “It was an awesome game winning for the second time against Ludwigsburg,” the happy coach said. “It felt like it was in front of 10,000 people.” 750 people were let into the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, and they got what they paid for. Not least of all because of the BBL top shooter T.J. Shorts, who landed 22 pointes and steered the game for his team. “The best player, who I have ever trained,“ said Gleim in praise. While at the same time on Patricks Team even the top performers like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) failed when they got to the line. Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total debacle and came within eight points, after which they were knocked back down to 39:59. Not just Johannes Patrick but Justin Simon also scored twelve points. There was luckily not a lot of time to fight. On Wednesday (7 PM) the giants will already host Skyliners Frankfurt in front of a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg.

translation1: "In the name of the people: Laypeople pass judgments in everyday clothing in the courtroom. But a lot depends on their verdict, even if they don't wear a robe: jurors, along with professional judges, determine whether and for how long someone goes to prison.Two of them report in conversation with the \"Public\" about their time at the Bad Kreuznacher Landgericht: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of a total of 125 lay judges at the Landgericht on John-F.-Kennedy-Straße."
reference: In the name of the people: Lay people give out judgement They are sitting in everyday clothes at the judge’s bank in the courthouse. A lot is depending on their decision, even if they are not wearing robes: Jurors are determining with professional judges if and for how long someone is behind bars. Two of them are reporting in a conversation with the “Oeffentlichen” about their time at the Bad Kreuznacher regional court: Sascha Wickert from Boos and Ruth Ertz from Bad Kreuznach are two of a total of 125 lay judges of the district court on John F. Kennedy Street.

translation1: "I am fed up with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, over the course of the season, the quality on German Sky has decreased more and more, so I want to vent a bit with this post. First of all, the transmission was interrupted mid-F2 race today to start the F1 pre-coverage on time.Although the delayed start and the accident at the beginning had put the schedule far behind schedule, it was still possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision (!). Apparently, however, this is not possible for legal reasons, so that everything else has to be restricted, which is why Sky DE probably had no choice. Nevertheless, it is stupid, especially since Sky UK was able to broadcast the end of the race.Nevertheless, a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartjes did a good job of accompanying the difficult situation around the heavy accident. Then there was rule ignorance among the F1 commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although there were similar situations in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen was allowed to change tires when there were corresponding radio messages about Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators knew immediately that this was possible for Verstappen. In my opinion, such basic rules should simply be known if you commentate on F1 at a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first puzzle-guessing, as now according to the rules, both have simply constant uncertainties in the subject of rules.I do not generally like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I acknowledge that it is a matter of taste. However, I seriously prefer Heiko Wasser from RTL. In addition, there are constant silliness that both simply appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.Just the latter brings a lot of turmoil into the commentary, as he apparently does not take it seriously. Not least, advertising simply takes over at Sky, where in the final round, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as can be heard on F1TV, where only the German audio track without commentary is available directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Even these two broadcasters make less advertising during training than Sky, and they are free-to-air broadcasters. However, one must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone does not overcome the disadvantages. The rest of Sky Sport F1's program is also very meager and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is really the worst German-language broadcaster that covers the F1. Unironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to broadcast. Thus, the fantastic F1 season is much less enjoyable than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster.I would like to hear your opinion."
reference: I am annoyed with Sky Sport F1 Hello F1 fans, the quality of German Sky decreased over the course of the season, such that I want to clear it up some with this post. First things first, today the transmission broke off in the middle of the F2 race in order to punctually begin the pre-show reporting of the F1. It was because of the delayed start and the falling accident that the schedule was so far behind what was planned, but you still could have let the last (planned) 10 minutes show as well as the tournament decision (!). Apparently because of legal reasons, F1 has priority and because of that everything else needs to be restricted such that Sky Germany didn’t really have a choice here. It is still dumb, because Sky UK transmitted the race up until the very end. In spite of that, some small praise: the announcer Olivier Zwartyes was a good accompaniment to the difficult situation and the unfortunate accident. In the F1 there was even knowledge gaps of the rules in the commentary by Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, both of them didn’t know that during a red flag the tires are allowed to be changed. Although this situation already came up this year in Imola, Baku and Silverstone, they both first came to the conclusion that Verstappen was allowed to switch his tires following corresponding radio messages on the topic to Hamilton. The announcers at Sky UK and RTL knew immediately that this was a possibility for Verstappen. I am of the opinion that knowledge of such elementary rules should be assumed if you are going to provide F1 commentary on a paid-for TV broadcaster. It's also not the first guessing game as to what is possible or required by the rules, both of them have constant uncertainties regarding rules. In general I don’t really like the artificial style of the commentary from Roos, but I’ll admit that is a manner of taste. But even Heiko Wasser from RTL does it better in my honest opinion. Additionally, there are just absurdities, which make the two of them seem unprofessional, like the ordering of coffee with the (just as clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or the “Ahhhh HD” from Ralf Schumacher. This last part really brings a lot of agitation into the commentary which he doesn’t take seriously. Not least of all, the advertising is just so prevalent on Sky, in the cool-down lap Sky is the only broadcaster that still goes to commercials, like you can hear this on F1TV, because only the German audio track comes out without commentary right after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this. Both of these broadcasters also do less commercials than Sky during training, and they are free TV broadcasters. You even have to congratulate Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone doesn’t cause me to overlook the disadvantages. The normal program from Sky Sport F1 is also very sparse and full of repetitions. All in all, Sky is really the worst German-speaking broadcaster that transmits the F1. In all honesty, RTL does a better job of transmitting the four races which they are allowed to transmit, including even the advertisements. At any rate, it really makes the grand F1 season considerably less fun as would be the case with a reasonable broadcaster. I would be really interested in your opinion.
